CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Lead Captured stage positioned above or below the Proposal Sent stage?
SRP.A: The Lead Captured stage is positioned {above} the Proposal Sent stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {exponential} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Proposal Sent?
VE.A: The value of stage Proposal Sent is {229}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Needs Analysis?
VE.A: The value of stage Needs Analysis is {274}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Lead Captured, with a value of {1005}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Proposal Sent, with a value of {229}.

SC.Q: How much did it decrease from stage Lead Captured to stage Initial Contact?
SC.A: Decreased by {573} Clients from stage Lead Captured to stage Initial Contact.

SC.Q: How much did it decrease from stage Initial Contact to stage Needs Analysis?
SC.A: Decreased by {158} Clients from stage Initial Contact to stage Needs Analysis.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 251? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Lead Captured} stage has {1005}, the {Initial Contact} stage has {432}, the {Needs Analysis} stage has {274}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 718? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Initial Contact} stage has {432}, the {Needs Analysis} stage has {274}, the {Proposal Sent} stage has {229}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 251 and 353? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Needs Analysis to Proposal Sent, or from stage Lead Captured to Initial Contact?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Lead Captured} to {Initial Contact} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Needs Analysis to Proposal Sent, from stage Lead Captured to Initial Contact, or from stage Initial Contact to Needs Analysis?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Lead Captured} to stage {Initial Contact} is the greatest.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Lead Captured} and {Initial Contact} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Needs Analysis} and {Proposal Sent} stages.
